ReviewList.Text: I would have rated a 4 if it had finished.  Instead, when it gets very interesting it tells you to buy the next book to know how the story ends.  Very disappointed.  I do not intend to purchase the second half!
This is the first half of a book which directs you to the second book for the conclusion....just saying...
The story is a great one but does not finish with this book.  You need the second one to finish and the second is NOT free.  This is a sorry way to get someone to buy a book.

It was a good story, but I wouldn't recommend you read it unless you're willing to pay for the end of the book.  The first book leaves you hanging.  It's unfortunate, because I will not pay to find out what happens at the end.
I agree that I was disappointed to have to buy the next book to get the rest of the story.  Are all her books like this?  If so I won't order any more.

Good story, but someone, somewhere, needs to proofread, and do a basic grammar check!  I have read school papers with fewer errors.  This is complicated by the fact that this is a teaser for the whole book and leaves us hanging with no ending in sight and yet another possible romantic interest introduced.  Too bad, as Ms. MacBride's style is engaging and the story moves right along.

Easy read and a good story line but it would have been nice to have book 1 play out the story before having to purchase book 2 (which really is a continuation of this book) to find out what happened. I like the author's writing style but a little disappointing at the abrupt ending.

This book has way too many distracting errors.  And now that I have read other reviews and see that it doesn't even "end," I am stopping at the 40% mark.  In the first 40%, it became clear that the author does not know when to use hyphens; does not read her sentences (if she did she would hopefully see the strange wordings, the missing words,and  the poor sentence structure, to name a few); and does not understand the difference between "your" and "you're."  "Your" and "you're errors are just....incomprehensible to me.  People in general these days don't seem to understand the difference between plural and possessive.  But if you call yourself a writer, you should learn the difference.
Misspelled words, was good reading but ending was very poor.

I really enjoyed the book until near the end when James and Sean appeared. I got the impression the publisher was pushing a deadline as well as insisting that it not end to increase sales of the next book.  Even though I have been blessed to not encounter emotional abuse, James' behavior had my blood boiling.

An easy read with an excellent story line.  This author needs to spend time on word usage and spelling, as well as the definition of the word book.  This is yet another segment, a true author would call it a preview. If you are going to write Christian novels, you may want to avoid this scam.
Good story...but very disappointed that you have to buy a second book to get to the ending.  Disappointed in the author that she allowed it and Amazon that they actually did it!
the story was good, but I did not know I had to buy the ending. This should have been made clear before reading the book.

From the very beginning this book is way too descriptive.  We are gave every single detail of every person Julie comes across.  There were points I had to skim read just to weed out the unimportant facts.  I think this book has a great story line but there's inconsistency in the plot.  And warning to readers this is the first half of a book which directs you to a second book.  I found this on Kindle Unlimited and sad to say I will not be paying for the 2nd book to find out the ending.  Clearly this book should have been a 2nd draft version for an editor to review!  Dear author please rewrite it!  There's a lot of potential to be a great book here but this version isn't it!

This book alludes to undeniable strength within the depths of crisis. The main character Julie questions her privileged lifestyle and fortune, and the expectations of fulfilling her parents ideology of the best fiance to maintain her lifestyle. Instead she escapes this impending wedding by running away. Fortunately she possess an abounding faith with God which her parents seem to lack. Through all her adventures, which are many, Julie captives and inspires all around her. Her motivation to live on her beliefs of service and gratitude propels her all inspiring adventure. This reader will continue enjoying the remainder of Julie's story in the next book!!!
